About

Hello, my name is Ryan Schachte. I am an avid runner, video blogger, software engineer, cognitive science enthusiast and prolific reader. I've recently graduated with my Master's degree in Computer Science from Arizona State University in 2017.

I've been extremely passionate about computers, programming and technology since the young age of 12 years old having developed some of my first websites and blogs. I love getting pulled into the complexities of software development, problem solving & mathematics, which sparked my interest into this field as a career.

Having shifted into a field that requires much discipline and patience, I began to study cognitive science as a side-hobby, specifically parts of the brain dealing with productivity and focus. Some of my favorite books that inspired me early on: Power of Habit, The Productivity Project, Deep Work & Mindset: The Psychology of Success. Learning is truly one of my greatest passions, which can be equally balance with teaching others to help grow the world of science and technology.

I currently work at Connexta as a software engineer and team lead. Previously, I was at ExxonMobil, Allstate Labs, IBM, Simplewan and Intel Corp. View the rest of my resume here.
